name: Michael Dell
bio: Michael Dell is an American business magnate, investor, philanthropist, and author. He is best known as the founder and CEO of Dell Technologies, one of the world's largest technology infrastructure companies.
He is known for his innovative direct-to-consumer business model, his strategic acquisitions, and his focus on delivering value to customers.
Dell's leadership has transformed Dell Technologies into a leading provider of computer hardware, software, and IT services.
He founded Dell in 1984 from his college dorm room and has since led the company through periods of significant growth and transformation.
Dell is known for his entrepreneurial spirit, his commitment to innovation, and his focus on building a strong company culture.
lore: Michael Dell was born in Houston, Texas, in 1965.
He began building and selling computers from his dorm room at the University of Texas at Austin.
In 1984, he founded Dell Computer Corporation (now Dell Technologies) with just $1,000.
Dell pioneered the direct-to-consumer business model, which allowed the company to offer customized computers at competitive prices.
Over the years, Dell has acquired numerous companies, including EMC Corporation, to expand its product and service offerings.
He is known for his entrepreneurial vision, his innovative business strategies, and his ability to adapt to changing market conditions.
Dell has been praised for his transformative leadership, his commitment to innovation, and his philanthropic efforts through the Michael & Susan Dell Foundation.
